snippet: About 30 percent of respondents said their compensation structure created pressure to compromise their standards or violate the law, according to a study released by the law firm Labaton Sucharow that involved 500 financial workers in the United...
abstract: About 30 percent of respondents said their compensation structure created pressure to compromise their standards or violate the law, according to a study released by the law firm Labaton Sucharow that involved 500 financial workers in the United States and Britain.

headline.main: Wall Street Short on Ethics, Report Finds
